ground_truth_articulation: The input is labeled True if any character appears two or more times consecutively (e.g., 'oo', 'ss').
generated_articulation:
The classification rule is:  
**A text is classified as True if it contains at least one double letter (i.e., two identical consecutive characters); otherwise, it is classified as False.**
raw_response:
The classification rule is:  
**A text is classified as True if it contains at least one double letter (i.e., two identical consecutive characters); otherwise, it is classified as False.**
llm_judge_reasoning: Both the ground truth and generated rules specify that an input is labeled True if it contains at least one occurrence of two identical characters in a row (double letters). They identify the same key pattern—consecutive identical characters—and their descriptions are semantically equivalent. The phrasing differs but the core concept and the classification logic are identical, leading to the same classifications across all inputs.
